Run with --scan to get full insights. * Get more help at https://help.gradle.org BUILD FAILED in 13s 2022-01-12 17:24:33 ERROR Error building OpenSearch, retry with: ./build.sh manifests/1.2.4/opensearch-1.2.4.yml --component OpenSearch --snapshot Traceback (most recent call last): File "./src/run_build.py", line 78, in sys.exit(main()) File "./src/run_build.py", line 66, in main builder.build(build_recorder) File "/var/jenkins/workspace/distribution-build-opensearch/src/build_workflow/builder_from_source.py", line 50, in build self.git_repo.execute(build_command) File "/var/jenkins/workspace/distribution-build-opensearch/src/git/git_repository.py", line 83, in execute subprocess.check_call(command, cwd=cwd, shell=True) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/subprocess.py", line 363, in check_call raise CalledProcessError(retcode, cmd) subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command 'bash /var/jenkins/workspace/distribution-build-opensearch/scripts/components/OpenSearch/build.sh -v 1.2.4 -p linux -a x64 -s true -o builds' returned non-zero exit status 1. ```

### What’s the problem? JCenter, which is a repository used in our builds, ceased operations today. Gradle was pulling dependencies from JCenter, and some repos have a direct dependency on it. This broke that the build process for OpenSearch engine, all branches so that the last successful build of 1.3 was at 7:03 AM PT Jan 12th. ### To Fix: 1. Remove any direct dependency on jcenter(). This would appear in a repositories block in build.gradle. [Example](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/pull/1057). 2. If your plugin depends on a gradle plugin that cannot currently be downloaded from https://plugins.gradle.org/ because its dependencies are failing to pull from jcenter. A workaround is to define a repositories block at the top of your settings.gradle file that allows us to control the order and first search in maven central. ``` pluginManagement { repositories { mavenCentral() gradlePluginPortal() } } ``` ### Remove JCenter Tasks - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/notifications/issues/373 - Notification team is not taking changes at this time. - [x] There are zero references to jcenter repositories in code, [query](https://github.com/search?q=org%3Aopensearch-project+jcenter%28%29+NOT+repo%3Aopensearch-project%2Fopensearch-docs+NOT+repo%3Aopensearch-project%2FOpenSearch+NOT+repo%3Aopensearch-project%2Fopensearch-build+NOT+repo%3Aopensearch-project%2Fdata-prepper+NOT+repo%3Aopensearch-project%2Fnotifications&type=code). - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/alerting/issues/278 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/asynchronous-search/issues/89 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/data-prepper/issues/1062 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/common-utils/issues/110 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/dashboards-reports/issues/276 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/perftop/issues/34 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/dashboards-notebooks/issues/110 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/data-prepper/issues/870 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/anomaly-detection/issues/357 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/k-NN/issues/260 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/sql/issues/377 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/geospatial/issues/16 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/cross-cluster-replication/issues/289 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/ml-commons/issues/120 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/observability/issues/372 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/security/pull/1625 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/project-website/pull/698 - [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/pull/1892

title: [Bug]: Entrypoint for Docker image erases config file
body:
### Describe the bug

After #1130 was merged, [this line](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/pull/1130/files#diff-107c2499e08c900c5ab75b5fd413c22bd9cf1ffe3819aeddabe51836ee4c58f5R72) completely wipes out the configuration file of the docker container on startup.

### To reproduce

```
docker run -it -p 9200:9200 -e "discovery.type=single-node" opensearchstaging/opensearch:1.2.4
```

as `1.2.4` is the first image built with this entrypoint.

### Expected behavior

Container should start up successfully.

### Screenshots

If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

MacOS, docker.

_No response_

title: Update test orchestrator pipeline
body:
The test orchestration pipeline (see [here](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/jenkins/test/orchestrator/Jenkinsfile)) is out of date, and the parameters being passed to the different test jobs are now invalid and don't work.

Work should be done to update these jobs in a consistent manner, where the same set of parameters can be passed to all of them. The integ test job has been updated as part of #1429

title: Minor bugfix for signArtifacts.groovy
body:
Signed-off-by: Abhinav Gupta <abhng@amazon.com>

### Description
Currently, the pgp key for signing is only imported if the file is downloaded. We only need to download the file ones, however, we need to import the key if the file already exists or when we download the file.
 
### Issues Resolved
pgp key failure will not happen for preexisting pgp key
 
### Check List
- [x] Commits are signed per the DCO using --signoff 

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.
For more information on following Developer Certificate of Origin and signing off your commits, please check [here](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#developer-certificate-of-origin).

title: [Bug]: SignArtifacts.groovy clones opensearch-build in the workspace and not in a folder
body:
### Describe the bug

`SignArtifacts.groovy` currently clones the `opensearch-build` repo in the same workspace without creating a folder. This can cause issues since there might be other repositories that maybe cloning the their repositories and would mix up all the files in one directory.

### To reproduce

Create a dummy job to clone any repository other than `opensearch-build` inside workspace on jenkins and call signer. After that, run `ls $WORKSPACE` to see files from both the repos in the same directory

### Expected behavior

`signArtifacts.groovy` should create a separate temp folder to clone and run the commands for signing process

### Acceptance Criteria
- `signArtifacts` works in an isolated directory that it creates
- all previous jobs should be able to run signAritfacts as expected (promoteArtifacts-job, signArtifacts-job, data-prepper-job)

### Screenshots

If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

### Host / Environment

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Relevant log output
data-prepper job for example clones `data-prepper` repository and signer clones `opensearch-build` and below are the contents of the final workspace with files from both repositories mixed in a single folder

```

title: [Bug]: Opensearch 1.2.3 s3 repository plugin checksum invalid

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: Issues that have not yet been triaged

body:
### Describe the bug

Trying to build a docker image based on 1.2.3 with s3 plugin

```
FROM opensearchproject/opensearch:1.2.3

ENV AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID XXXX
ENV AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY XXXX

RUN /usr/share/opensearch/bin/opensearch-plugin install --batch repository-s3
RUN /usr/share/opensearch/bin/opensearch-keystore create

RUN echo $AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID | /usr/share/opensearch/bin/opensearch-keystore add --stdin s3.client.default.access_key
RUN echo $AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY | /usr/share/opensearch/bin/opensearch-keystore add --stdin s3.client.default.secret_key

COPY geant_nl_interm_root.cer /usr/share/opensearch/config
COPY geant_nl_root_interm.cer /usr/share/opensearch/config

RUN /usr/share/opensearch/jdk/bin/keytool -noprompt -import -alias geant_nl_interm_root -keystore /usr/share/opensearch/jdk/lib/security/cacerts -file /usr/share/opensearch/config/geant_nl_interm_root.cer -storepass changeit
RUN /usr/share/opensearch/jdk/bin/keytool -noprompt -import -alias geant_nl_root_interm -keystore /usr/share/opensearch/jdk/lib/security/cacerts -file /usr/share/opensearch/config/geant_nl_root_interm.cer -storepass changeit

```

    self.properties.check_value("version", self.checked_version)

```

We need to update the 1.2.0 manifest to use refs that point to before the latest change on the 1.2 branches since they were reused.  This also is something that we should have aprocess for after a build is release to prevent follow up work like this again, might be doable in one go to fix this release, or something that should be pulled out into another issue.

title: [Bug]Separate OpenSearch Min Version and Bundle Version in Input Manifest
body:
### Describe the bug

When building 1.1.1 based on 1.1.0 artifacts for opensearch (BE), we take every plugin from 1.1.0 zips except reports-scheduler, which requires a build from source for `1.1.1.0` version patches.

The problem is, when building with gradle, build-tools is pointing to `1.1.1` which does not exist since we do not change min version.

```
+ ./gradlew assemble --no-daemon --refresh-dependencies -DskipTests=true -Dopensearch.version=1.1.1 -Dbuild.snapshot=false
```

The param `opensearch.version` is the min version, not the plugin version and `1.1.1` is passed to the build.sh, thus cause the build process trying to find `1.1.1` version of build-tools/min in order to build.

title: Publish build artifacts to correct locations from snapshot builds
body:
Automation for 1.2.0 was building and uploading snapshots to maven at https://aws.oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/org/opensearch/common-utils/, there was another process that was building and uploading to maven which has deleted items under `1.2.0.0-SNAPSHOT/`.

### Disabled these jobs on private jenkins instance:
- opensearch_snapshots_creation_1_0_0
- opensearch_dashboards_snapshots_creation_1_0_0
  * These jobs have been updated so they are safe to run, but are only executed on demand, see `Snapshots_CI/job/opensearch_snapshots_creation_1_0_0` on the fork jenkins fleet.

Acceptance Criteria:
- After snapshots are built in the distribution workflow they are uploaded onto a location like `https://artifacts.opensearch.org/snapshots/core/opensearch-dashboards/2.0.0-SNAPSHOT/opensearch-dashboards-min-2.0.0-SNAPSHOT-linux-arm64-latest.tar.gz` that can be consumed by distribution downloader
- Also include min build version to 
  - https://artifacts.opensearch.org/release-candidates/core/opensearch/1.2.1/opensearch-min-1.2.1-linux-x64.tar.gz
  - https://artifacts.opensearch.org/release-candidates/core/opensearch/1.2.1/opensearch-min-1.2.1-linux-arm64.tar.gz

title: [Bug] Docker Image support running without security and PA plugin
body:
### Describe the bug

#1154 issue follow up after fixing docker build issues.

https://github.com/tianleh/opensearch-build/blob/main/docker/release/config/opensearch/opensearch-docker-entrypoint.sh#L100-L131

As of now we expect docker image to have security and PA plugin install by default.
If PA failed to start then OS will also terminate.

This behavior is ok for previous releases, but having issues in 1.3.0 since we dont have branches for security and PA yet, and the bundle build pipeline is still triggering snapshots builds on a daily basis for docker images.

We can resolve this by decoupling PA and OS if PA not exists.

Thanks.

title: [Bug]: Docker build skipped if arm64 or x64 artifact wasn't uploaded
body:
### Describe the bug

In https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/pull/1147#discussion_r758776578 incremental build skips building and uploading x64 or arm64 artifacts if there were no changes. Then, if either was skipped, docker build is skipped by checking whether the files exist. If I make a mistake and fail to produce x64 or arm64 build for some random reason, docker build is quietly skipped too. 

### To reproduce

N/A

### Expected behavior

Only skip docker build when explicitly artifacts to build were skipped because the build was incremental, not for any other reason.

title: Remove brittle snapshot publish script.
body:
Right now the bundle build relies on snapshot artifacts being placed in a local /maven folder during build and a [script](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/publish/publish-snapshot.sh) is invoked that [publishes them during in our nightly jenkins workflow](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/jenkins/opensearch/Jenkinsfile#L53). 

This script is brittle and relies on artifacts being named properly to be picked up - #1180 #439 

Rather than publishing to a local folder and publishing the snapshot artifacts on the behalf of each repository.  Each component should include its own gradle [task](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/build.gradle#L110
) to publish to our snapshot repository.  This task can be invoked directly from each component's build.sh.

```
        maven {
          name = 'Snapshots'
          url = 'https://aws.oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots'
          credentials {
            username "$System.env.SONATYPE_USERNAME"
            password "$System.env.SONATYPE_PASSWORD"
          }
```

This would require a flag to the build workflow to optionally publish the snapshots inside of a build.sh so that local builds do not attempt to publish.

title: Resolve issues that break docker builds in #1154 for 1.3 OpenSearch/Dashboards Bundle Builds
body:
Signed-off-by: Peter Zhu <zhujiaxi@amazon.com>

### Description
Resolve issues that break docker builds in #1154 of build repo

Initially #1154 stated that docker build is not running due to both security and PA plugin not present in 1.3 yet, thus cause `COPY` function to fail in dockerfiles of OpenSearch, as the target dir does not exist due to these plugins not installed.

Previously a PR #1162 tried to address the issue but ends up mix the usages between `COPY` and `cp`.

After some investigation, there are three issues that present in the codebase that prevents docker build on 1.3 branch running correctly:

1. #1145 change the S3 folder structure, cause opensearch/dashboards tarball not to be able to download correctly.
2. As stated above, `COPY` and `cp` means different context in dockerfile, one cannot use `cp` to replace `COPY`.
3. In #1133, a incorrect username is appended for docker hub login, cause docker image to not to be able to push to remote.

More logs in: https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/issues/1154#issuecomment-981894695

This PR addresses all the issues above, ensures the image can be correctly built for both OpenSearch and OpenSearch-Dashboards. There are further issues to be address for docker run later #1185.
 
### Issues Resolved
#1154
 
### Check List
- [x] Commits are signed per the DCO using --signoff 

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.
For more information on following Developer Certificate of Origin and signing off your commits, please check [here](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#developer-certificate-of-origin).

title: [Bug]: Out of date archive test distribution (for 1.1) may be causing plugin BWC test failures for Replication Plugin
body:
### Describe the bug

For BWC test on replication plugin, we create 1.1 clusters and upgrade those to 1.2. During the test, start replication call is failing on 1.1 cluster as it fails to resolve `INDEX_PLUGINS_REPLICATION_TRANSLOG_RETENTION_LEASE_PRUNING_ENABLED_SETTING` which is imported from `IndexSettings`: 
- https://github.com/opensearch-project/cross-cluster-replication/blob/1.1/src/main/kotlin/org/opensearch/replication/task/index/IndexReplicationTask.kt#L81
- https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/1.1/server/src/main/java/org/opensearch/common/settings/IndexScopedSettings.java#L159

```
» [2021-11-16T02:30:28.977625Z] [BUILD] Stopping node
»   ↓ last 40 non error or warning messages from /home/runner/work/cross-cluster-replication/cross-cluster-replication/build/testclusters/bwcFollower0-1/logs/opensearch.stderr.log ↓
» fatal error in thread [opensearch[bwcFollower0-1][clusterApplierService#updateTask][T#1]], exiting
»  java.lang.NoSuchFieldError: INDEX_PLUGINS_REPLICATION_TRANSLOG_RETENTION_LEASE_PRUNING_ENABLED_SETTING
»  	at org.opensearch.replication.task.index.IndexReplicationTask.<clinit>(IndexReplicationTask.kt:138)
»  	at org.opensearch.replication.task.index.IndexReplicationExecutor.createTask(IndexReplicationExecutor.kt:69)
»  	at org.opensearch.persistent.PersistentTasksNodeService$1.createTask(PersistentTasksNodeService.java:182)
»  	at org.opensearch.tasks.TaskManager.register(TaskManager.java:146)
»  	at org.opensearch.persistent.PersistentTasksNodeService.startTask(PersistentTasksNodeService.java:188)
»  	at org.opensearch.persistent.PersistentTasksNodeService.clusterChanged(PersistentTasksNodeService.java:129)

»  	at org.opensearch.cluster.service.ClusterApplierService.callClusterStateListeners(ClusterApplierService.java:529)
»  	at org.opensearch.cluster.service.ClusterApplierService.applyChanges(ClusterApplierService.java:497)
»  	at org.opensearch.cluster.service.ClusterApplierService.runTask(ClusterApplierService.java:431)
»  	at org.opensearch.cluster.service.ClusterApplierService.access$000(ClusterApplierService.java:81)
»  	at org.opensearch.cluster.service.ClusterApplierService$UpdateTask.run(ClusterApplierService.java:175)
»  	at org.opensearch.common.util.concurrent.ThreadContext$ContextPreservingRunnable.run(ThreadContext.java:697)
»  	at org.opensearch.common.util.concurrent.PrioritizedOpenSearchThreadPoolExecutor$TieBreakingPrioritizedRunnable.runAndClean(PrioritizedOpenSearchThreadPoolExecutor.java:266)
»  	at org.opensearch.common.util.concurrent.PrioritizedOpenSearchThreadPoolExecutor$TieBreakingPrioritizedRunnable.run(PrioritizedOpenSearchThreadPoolExecutor.java:229)
»  	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1130)
»  	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:630)
»  	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:832)
``` 

`INDEX_PLUGINS_REPLICATION_TRANSLOG_RETENTION_LEASE_PRUNING_ENABLED_SETTING` was removed as part of 1.2(pushed to `1.x` and `main`) but should still exists in 1.1: https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/commit/2cb71a33b8ed7ef289608809f03762768d0aeefd


I've built the OS 1.1 locally and used artifacts from maven local and didn't ran into this issue. Can you please ensure that the 1.1 artefacts are also being published correctly?

Here is the testCluster definition for BWC clusters: https://github.com/opensearch-project/cross-cluster-replication/blob/bwc_2/build.gradle#L451-L485


### To reproduce

BWC test on replication are failing on main branch right now. To circumvent this, I'm currently running it on CI in a pvt branch.
To reproduce, we can simply restart the CI job: https://github.com/opensearch-project/cross-cluster-replication/runs/4219767362?check_suite_focus=true

### Expected behavior

Replication plugin should be able to resolve `INDEX_PLUGINS_REPLICATION_TRANSLOG_RETENTION_LEASE_PRUNING_ENABLED_SETTING` on `1.1` artifacts.

### Screenshots

If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

title: [Bug]: Out of date archive test distribution may be causing plugin IT test failures
body:
### Describe the bug

Parallel issue on core which has been identified as a release blocker for 1.2: https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/issues/1473

Integration tests for the Index Management plugin which extend from OpenSearchIntegTestCase are failing during cleanup following the addition of shard indexing pressure stats in [this PR,](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/pull/1336) which are causing a serialization mismatch. The new fields are included in serialization when the version is on or after 1.2.0, and debug logging has shown that both sides of the stream are on version 1.2.0, but the fields are written and not read. 

This failure can be replicated with an empty test extending from OpenSearchIntegTestCase, on at least Alerting, Index Management, and Anomaly Detection if the testDistribution is set to ARCHIVE and the integTest gradle task is run. These test failures have been isolated to Index Management as only this test setup is only used in Index Management. 

It appears that when the test distribution is set to archive, this artifact is used: https://artifacts.opensearch.org/snapshots/core/opensearch/1.2.0-SNAPSHOT/opensearch-min-1.2.0-SNAPSHOT-linux-x64-latest.tar.gz
After unpacking the snapshot, you can see that the shard indexing pressure changes are not included in the code, and the state of the snapshot code would precisely cause these errors. Additionally, the equivalent snapshot is not yet available for 1.3.0, so there may be an issue with building these artifacts. 

### To reproduce

On a plugin, using this empty integration test with the test distribution set to ARCHIVE, the test always fails during cleanup:

```
import org.opensearch.test.OpenSearchIntegTestCase;

public class EmptyTestsIT extends OpenSearchIntegTestCase {

    public void testEmpty() {
        System.out.println("This does print, we fail in cleanup");
    }
}
```

### Expected behavior

The test setup as described should not fail. This same test setup has been used in Index Management for a long time now, and changes to serialization in the NodeStats API should not cause it to fail.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Host / Environment

I have been able to replicate this locally on my Amazon Linux 2 desktop, and it occurs every time on Index Management's CI run. [Here](https://github.com/opensearch-project/index-management/runs/3978592708?check_suite_focus=true) is a failing run.

### Additional context

_No response_

### Relevant log output

title: [Bug]: Reporting build missing chromium dependency

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: Issues that have not yet been triaged

body:
### Describe the bug

dashboards-reports plugin uses chromium to generate reports, the binary should be included in the artifact like this:
https://github.com/opensearch-project/dashboards-reports/blob/main/.github/workflows/dashboards-reports-test-and-build-workflow.yml#L67-L91

But this part is missing in [build.sh](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/scripts/components/reportsDashboards/build.sh#L64-L77).

### To reproduce

Run opensearch and dashboards, reporting does not work because chromium binary `reportsDashboards/.chromium/headless_shell` does not exist

title: Prevent unit tests failures when adding/removing components from manifests
body:
Signed-off-by: Peter Nied <petern@amazon.com>

### Description
When making changes to add components to manifests this would cause some of the unit tests to fail because they depend on the manifest files for test data.  This is causing partner teams to have to resolve issues that are unrelated to their changes.

### Testing
On my machine I updated the manifest opensearch with an additional entry to discover the affected unit tests and then repair them.

### Check List
- [X] Commits are signed per the DCO using --signoff 

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.
For more information on following Developer Certificate of Origin and signing off your commits, please check [here](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#developer-certificate-of-origin).

title: [Bug]: Windows build packages opensearch-tar-install.sh
body:
### Describe the bug

Windows build packages opensearch-tar-install.sh via [this script](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/scripts/components/OpenSearch/install.sh#L75).

### Expected behavior

Port the [`opensearch-tar-install.sh`](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/scripts/legacy/tar/linux/opensearch-tar-install.sh) script to `opensearch-zip-install.bat` and package it into the windows distribution instead. That .bat will need to call a new Windows version of the install security demo configuration script, which is https://github.com/opensearch-project/security/issues/1476.

title: [Bundle Build Break] Make sure k-NN is building with updated docker images
body:
> From: https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/pull/810
> dblock: I merged this. I believe we need to make a new CI runner with these changes and update it in the manifests, but I don't know what that takes

We need to make sure the build process is using the updates docker images:
#### Validate that k-NN can build
- [x] Locally build and startup the docker image, [dockerfile](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/docker/ci/dockerfiles/ci-runner.centos7.dockerfile)
- [x] Copy the git clone/ build systems from the [bundle job](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/jenkins/opensearch/Jenkinsfile#L72) and execute them in the docker container
- [ ] If there are any errors create issues and track them down

#### Update the docker image on the CI system
- [x] Use [dockerfile](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/docker/ci/dockerfiles/ci-runner.centos7.dockerfile) to build the image for publishing
- [x] Request permission to docker hub org
- [x] Publish updated image to docker hub 
- [x] Update the pointer to the current docker images [build manifest](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/manifests/1.2.0/opensearch-1.2.0.yml#L5)
- [x] Make sure that the imaging picking process will still work, [jenkinsfile](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/jenkins/opensearch/Jenkinsfile#L33)
- [x] Create PR(s) and merge everything
- [x] Verify that the build is passing in the build release slack channel

Note: Review [docker release](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/tree/main/docker/release) covers the process for release docker images which are likely simaliar to what we are doing with the CI images

title: Fix build break by attaching jvm image detection to an agent node
body:
### Description
Attached the jvm detection logic inside of an docker container.

We have a requirement to not run jobs on the main jenkins node for security concerns.  We enforce running in a container to keep jobs resource isolated since many build tools use shared system caches/components.
 
### Issues
* Resolves #790

### Testing
Full build with this change under my one-off build pipeline

### Check List
- [X] Commits are signed per the DCO using --signoff 

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.
For more information on following Developer Certificate of Origin and signing off your commits, please check [here](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#developer-certificate-of-origin).

title: [Bug]: Signature validation fails on nexus sonatype repos
body:
### Describe the bug

When we upload the artifacts in nexus sonatype repository it does a bunch of central sync checks.
one of them is signature validation. It looks up to below servers:

- keyserver.ubuntu.com
- keys.openpgp.org
- pgp.mit.edu

We have only updated our public key in pgp.mit.edu (http://pgp.mit.edu:11371/pks/lookup?search=0xc2ee2af6542c03b4&op=index)

However, pgp.mit.edu is very flaky and unreachable at times. This leads to signature validation failures due to key not found.

We need to upload the keys to other 2 servers as well as a fail-safe 

### To reproduce

Close the staged repositories in nexus sonatype and see that it fails sometimes due to signature validation

### Expected behavior

The signature-validation should not fail due to key not found

### Screenshots

![image (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61760125/138173869-3b44cf16-231c-4f39-892e-0f66a35b1bd0.png)

### Work Around

Keep retrying and hope it passes

title: [Bug]: Dashboards build agent can't build on ARM64 due to chromium missing
body:
### Describe the bug

When running the build for OpenSearch Dashboards in Jenkins it will attempt to use a build agent that does not have chromium installed which is needed to even bootstrap OpenSearch Dashboards.

Might be more difficult than initially looked at because even if you try to just pass it to the Dashboards dependencies within the [Jenkinsfile](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/docker/ci/dockerfiles/ci-runner.al2.dockerfile#L26) it will have no clue what the package is. Even tried to install the EPEL release package [[here](https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/knowledge-center/ec2-enable-epel/)] and then install chromium as suggested online in some locations but any type of chromium is still not available after installing that package.


### To reproduce

I have tried using an AL2 instance with the Dockerfile for CentOS. Will try that but if you try to run it using the Dockerfile for AL2, you won't be able to install chromium still. Then if you try to build OpenSearch Dashboards you will the error message while running `yarn osd bootstrap`:

```

Bootstrapping OpenSearch Dashboards builds successfully.

title: [Bug]: [Docker][opensearch-dashboards] The home dir is owned by root
body:
### Describe the bug

The home dir of the `opensearch-dashboards` user is owned by root in the Docker image. We can't write file in this home dir.

The `opensearch` image doesn't have this problem.

I can't find where it is coming from in the Dockerfile: https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/docker/release/dockerfiles/opensearch-dashboards.al2.dockerfile All seem right to me.

```
[root@myserver ~]# docker run -it --rm opensearchproject/opensearch:1.0.1 bash -c "pwd ; ls -ld"
/usr/share/opensearch
drwx------ 1 opensearch opensearch 75 Aug 31 23:07 .
[root@myserver ~]#

/usr/share/opensearch-dashboards
drwxr-xr-x 1 root root 302 Oct  5 21:31 .
[root@myserver ~]#

title: [Bug] maven-metadata-local.xml files are preventing publishing to maven central
body:
When running stage-maven-release.sh all files from the build are included, there are some files such as `maven-metadata-local.xml` present that are causing problems when published because they have already been published.

We should determine if we can exclude these artifacts or if there are any additional artifacts that are not needed.

title: [Bug]: stage-maven-release.sh process leaves artifacts in the upload directory
body:
After running stage-maven-release.sh a file is created that will automatically be uploaded if the script runs a second time, the upload process should be idempotent to prevent pollution of the environment or for a retry of the process.

Filename: 
```
{SONATYPE_PROFILE_ID}.properties
```
File Contents:
```
#Generated by org.sonatype.plugins:nexus-staging-maven-plugin:1.6.5
#Thu Oct 07 02:31:22 UTC 2021
stagingRepository.id=orgopensearch-1012
stagingRepository.url=https\://aws.oss.sonatype.org\:443/content/repositories/orgopensearch-1012
stagingRepository.profileId={SONATYPE_PROFILE_ID}
stagingRepository.managed=false
```

See [AbstractStagingDeployStrategy.java](https://github.com/sonatype/nexus-maven-plugins/blob/master/staging/maven-plugin/src/main/java/org/sonatype/nexus/maven/staging/deploy/strategy/AbstractStagingDeployStrategy.java#L154) from `org.sonatype.plugins:nexus-staging-maven-plugin` where this is documented.  It does not look like it can be disabled or the file location altered.

title: [Performance] Need to validate the 1.1.0 without security performance tests
body:
We should retrigger this test process for both x86 and arm64 with lots of debugging logging including #696 as well as other logging that would be useful to root cause and resolve any issues running these tests.

After getting successful runs back we should make fixes for any issues encountered.

title: Request level logging during the tests
body:
There was problems during the no-security enabled test runs for both arm64 and x86, 100% failure rate from the perf testing system.  After inspecting the hosts we were not able to find any errors or request logs that indicated the source of the issue. 

When we deploy a OpenSearch cluster to run performance tests we should have request logs saved on disk so we can correlate any aberrate behavior to what the testing system saw.

title: [Bug]: node.data, node.ingest, and node.master deprecation

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: Issues that have not yet been triaged

body:
### Describe the bug

Upon starting v1.0.0, depreciation warnings are generated for the `node.data`, `node.ingest`, and `node.master` configuration options although they appear in the current [documentation](https://opensearch.org/docs/opensearch/cluster/#master-node).

```
{"type": "deprecation", "timestamp": "2021-10-05T11:26:37,811-07:00", "level": "DEPRECATION", "component": "o.o.d.c.s.Settings", "cluster.name": "T4", "node.name": "node1.0", "message": "[node.master] setting was deprecated in OpenSearch and will be removed in a future release! See the breaking changes documentation for the next major version." }
{"type": "deprecation", "timestamp": "2021-10-05T11:26:37,814-07:00", "level": "DEPRECATION", "component": "o.o.d.c.s.Settings", "cluster.name": "T4", "node.name": "node1.0", "message": "[node.data] setting was deprecated in OpenSearch and will be removed in a future release! See the breaking changes documentation for the next major version." }
{"type": "deprecation", "timestamp": "2021-10-05T11:26:37,814-07:00", "level": "DEPRECATION", "component": "o.o.d.c.s.Settings", "cluster.name": "T4", "node.name": "node1.0", "message": "[node.ingest] setting was deprecated in OpenSearch and will be removed in a future release! See the breaking changes documentation for the next major version." }
```

I did not see any mention of these in the [release notes](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/release-notes/opensearch-release-notes-1.0.0.md) either.



### To reproduce

Define the following in the `opensearch.yml` file:

```
node.master: false
node.data: true
node.ingest: true
```

### Expected behavior

If these are in fact deprecated, the documentation should provide the replacement configuration options otherwise a warning should not be generated.

### Screenshots

If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

### Host / Environment

Ubuntu 18LTS

### Additional context

_No response_

### Relevant log output

_No response_

title: Handle PUBLIC_ARTIFACT_URL without trailing slash
body:
### Description
In the build workflow the path was added as `https://ci.opensearch.org/ci/dbc`, and when `urljoin` was used on that value it unexpectly removed the last element on the url [[StackOverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10893374/python-confusions-with-urljoin)].

Instead of 'altering' the value in jenkins and breaking the notification message, updated the build script to handle this case and added many unit tests.
 
### Issues Resolved
Resolves #661
 
### Check List
- [X] Commits are signed per the DCO using --signoff

title: [Bug]: Distribution builds can have path collisions
body:
Distribution builds are not namespace'd based on the type of artifact produced so an OpenSearch and OpenSearch Dashboard build could collide.

### Actual
The current path generated is `https://ci.opensearch.org/ci/dbc/builds/1.1.0/328/x64/manifest.yml`.

### Expected
It should have the distribution type in the path like `https://ci.opensearch.org/ci/dbc/opensearch/builds/1.1.0/328/x64/manifest.yml` and `https://ci.opensearch.org/ci/dbc/opensearch-dashboards/builds/1.1.0/328/x64/manifest.yml`

### Required changes
- [x] Update the build jobs to include the build type in the url for the generated manifests, see [bundle_recorder.py](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/src/assemble_workflow/bundle_recorder.py).
- [x] Update the jenkinsfile to upload to a destination based on the build type, see [Jenkinsfile](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/Jenkinsfile#L127).

### Other changes
- [ ] Migrate/ update existing artifacts to the new destination
- [x] Update the [roles](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/deployment/lib/identities.ts#L11) to be separate between jobs to prevent any possible conflicts, then update the jenkins jobs to build to the correct destination.
- [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/issues/661
- [x] https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/issues/714

title: [Bug]: The location specified in bundle-manifest (manifest.yml) are invalid

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: Issues that have not yet been triaged

body:
### Describe the bug

A build manifest is bundled inside the OpenSearch bundle tarball (manifest.yml) which contains all the information about the components used to build the bundle. The bundle manifest contains a key `location` whose value is invalid for all components.

```
build:
  architecture: x64
  id: '317'
  location: https://ci.opensearch.org/ci/bundles/1.1.0/317/opensearch-1.1.0-linux-x64.tar.gz
  name: OpenSearch
  version: 1.1.0
components:
- commit_id: 15e9f137622d878b79103df8f82d78d782b686a1
  location: https://ci.opensearch.org/ci/builds/1.1.0/317/bundle/opensearch-min-1.1.0-linux-x64.tar.gz
  name: OpenSearch
  ref: '1.1'
  repository: https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch.git
```

### To reproduce

Download the bundle. Untar it and see the manifest.yml

Try accessing the location url to download individual component. It will give `Access Denied` error

### Expected behavior

The URLs should be valid. Each component should be downloadable from the given location url

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Host / Environment

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Relevant log output

_No response_

title: [Bug] Remove space from dashboards bundled tarball
body:
### Description
Previously when running the assemble script, the tarball produced
would be 'opensearch dashboards-1.1.0-linux-x64.tar.gz'. In the bundle
recorder it would take the name and lower case it to make the parts.

This adds replacing spaces with hyphens while accessing the name.

Signed-off-by: Kawika Avilla <kavilla414@gmail.com>
 
### Issues Resolved
https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/issues/602
 
### Check List
- [x] Commits are signed per the DCO using --signoff 

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.
For more information on following Developer Certificate of Origin and signing off your commits, please check [here](https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#developer-certificate-of-origin).

title: [Whitesource] Investigate over scanning of dependencies
body:
There seems to be an inconsistency on what WhiteSource updated to its dashboard. 
We followed the exact same procedures for scanning one plugin repo but published the libraries to different Products on WhiteSource Dashboard. 
The Product we actually tracked contains more dependencies than we used for that repo. The other product always has reasonable number of libraries scanned.
We are investigating on this issue.

title: [Bug] Remove psutil as a dependency in Pipfile

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: Issues that have not yet been triaged

body:
### Describe the bug

I am not sure why `pstuil` is being added as dependency in bundle-workflow.
https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/bundle-workflow/Pipfile#L24
It is not supported in many places.

1. It does not support arm64 arch listed here: https://github.com/giampaolo/psutil/issues/1966
2. It does not support Windows on cygwin: https://github.com/giampaolo/psutil/issues/82 (issue opened in 2010 and a contributor attempt to work on it but PR closed later)

It is only used right here for test:
https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/927d87b59b369f00b2a366c4f29ffb0d7ff3d342/bundle-workflow/src/test_workflow/integ_test/local_test_cluster.py

@setiah @gaiksaya can you chime in for more information on why we need this?
Or we can have a path on how to resolve this later.




### To reproduce

See above.

title: [BUG][Chart Name] JAVA_HOME env
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

securityadmin.sh cant assing a value to the JAVA_HOME env and it uses the which command to find the path for java but the which command doenst exist also in the container.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
i would suggest to add the java_home by default in the container.
**Describe alternatives you've considered**
You can use the ExtraEnvs in the values.yml as follow :
extraEnvs: 
    - name : JAVA_HOME
      value: /usr/share/opensearch/jdk
**Additional context**
N/A

title: [Bug]: OpenSearch Bundle Workflow couldn't build OpenSearch 1.0.0 and 1.0.1
body:
### Describe the bug

With the commit https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/commit/1658890d407f55eb25d2cc904324470fb48d4ddd, the validation for build artifact version number is added.

The build of OpenSearch failed due to the version number mismatch.

For 1.0.0:
The manifest file uses "1.0" branch to build, 
https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/7765fd378ce5351ab60953ac5d1cd08e7d6c7300/manifests/1.0.0/opensearch-1.0.0.yml#L9
but "1.0" branch has bumped version to 1.0.1 (https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/commit/1d59eafd7b2a2c178e3bc7d54f11cffefd1a0edc).

For 1.0.1:
The OpenSearch version actually doesn't change in bundle version 1.0.1, so it remains 1.0.0

### To reproduce

in `main` branch:
```
./bundle-workflow/build.sh manifests/1.0.0/opensearch-1.0.0.yml

./bundle-workflow/build.sh manifests/1.0.0/opensearch-1.0.1.yml
```

### Expected behavior

_No response_

title: [BUG] Docker container intermittently failing to start in CI
body:
We're running the official OpenSearch Docker image in our CI pipeline for our automated integration tests, however, the container intermittently fails to start (around 50% of the time).

Looking at the Docker logs, it isn't clear as to why with the limited info returned (is there a way to get further logs from the container?):

```
          Name                        Command               State 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
api_opensearch-testing_1   ./opensearch-docker-entryp ...   Exit 0
                                                                                                                     
opensearch-testing_1     | Killing opensearch process 10
opensearch-testing_1     | Killing performance analyzer process 11
opensearch-testing_1     | OpenSearch exited with code 143
opensearch-testing_1     | Performance analyzer exited with code 143
```

The service entry in the docker-compose.yml file is dead simple:

```
version: "3"

services:
  # ...

  opensearch-testing:
    image: opensearchproject/opensearch:1.0.1
    environment:
      discovery.type: single-node
```

By retrying the build several times, it eventually works, but obviously, this isn't ideal. 

For reference, we're running this in GitHub Actions against their `ubuntu-18.04` environment.

Has anyone else run into this problem, or has any suggestions to try?

title: publish-snapshot script is publishing the first jar it finds next to a pom.

labels.name: triaged
labels.description: This issue has been reviewed by the triage team

body:
We have Snapshot publications that are including extra jars.  These jars are incorrectly being picked up by the [publish-snapshot.sh](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/publish/publish-snapshot.sh#L114) script and published with mvn deploy-file.  As a result it is pushed to Sonatype as the latest publication, but is not the correct jar.

For example
`org/opensearch/gradle/build-tools/1.1.0-SNAPSHOT/` publishes two jars:
`build-tools-1.1.0-SNAPSHOT-test-fixtures.jar` and `build-tools-1.1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar`

The script is picking up `build-tools-1.1.0-SNAPSHOT-test-fixtures.jar` and pushing under sonatype as:
`
/org/opensearch/gradle/build-tools/1.1.0-SNAPSHOT/build-tools-1.1.0-20210910.002130-165.jar`

When the dependency is used, the incorrect jar is fetched.  Specifically for plugins & build-tools, this results in the following error.

```
* Where:
Build file '/Users/handalm/workspace/job-scheduler/build.gradle' line: 48

* What went wrong:
A problem occurred evaluating root project 'opensearch-job-scheduler'.
> Plugin with id 'opensearch.opensearchplugin' not found.
```
Note - this is *NOT* an issue for release builds that are pushed with the stage-maven-release.sh script.  That script using a separate nexus staging plugin that pushes all artifacts that are in the folder.  Unfortunately we cannot use that to push snapshots.

title: [BUG] Missing CI checks for various components
body:
**Describe the bug**

After https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/pull/414 we're missing some CI checks for the following.

- [x] security is missing all checks, need maven versions of checks; it also can't properly support snapshot versions because we hack those in https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/bundle-workflow/scripts/components/security/build.sh#L66
- [x] performance-analyzer-rca is missing a dependencies check, need to support a custom gradle command to run to get those or teach alerting to respond to `gradle plugin:dependencies`

title: [BUG] Opensearch cluster won't start and gives permission denied error

labels.name: beta
labels.description: Issues specific to the OpenSearch Beta

body:
**Describe the bug**
```
/bin/sh: 1: ./opensearch-tar-install.sh: Permission denied
```
This is an executable file on [github](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/release/tar/linux/opensearch-tar-install.sh) that is bundled (zipped) with all plugins and core. Somehow the file permissions changed making it in-executable in the bundle and giving permission error when user tries to start opensearch 

This file should be executable so that the user can start opensearch.
**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Clone this repo and see that `opensearch-tar-install.sh` is executable
2. Now download the recent bundle (created using new build system)
3. Untar the bundle and see the permission of `opensearch-tar-install.sh` in the un-tar-ed directory

**Expected behavior**
User should be able to start opensearch by running `./opensearch-tar-install.sh`

title: [BUG] LocalTestCluster fails during create and destroy

labels.name: beta
labels.description: Issues specific to the OpenSearch Beta

body:
**Describe the bug**
The LocalTestCluster is not working with recent opensearch tarballs and fails to launch the OpenSearch process successfully. There are a couple of sub-issues here

1. The OpenSearch process is not setup properly.
2. The PID of the OpenSearch process seems to be reported incorrectly. It is the pid of shell subprocess that starts OpenSearch process. 
2. Missing logs to debug the opensearch process setup failures. The opensearch-tar-install.sh script logs are not available in stdout for debugging failure.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Stub the download() method and provide a pre-downloaded and uncompressed tarball. Then use LocalTestCluster `create()` method to spin the cluster. It is the `create()` method where problem is seen.

**Expected behavior**
OpenSearch cluster should setup correctly and querying on port 9200 should respond. The opensearch logs should be reported on stdout for debugging.

**Plugins**
Full bundle - ran test with security.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Host/Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Linux
 - Version = 1.1.0

title: [BUG] build-image-multi-arch.sh -a option only checks first input

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: Issues that have not yet been triaged

labels.name: beta
labels.description: Issues specific to the OpenSearch Beta

body:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
The line 87,
`IFS=',' read -r -a ARCHITECTURE_ARRAY <<< "$ARCHITECTURE"`
Only takes first input into ARCHITECTURE, which gets evaluated below at line 97
`if [ "$ARCHITECTURE" != "x64" ] && [ "$ARCHITECTURE" != "arm64" ]`
So it only evaluates the first input from ARCHITECTURE_ARRAY, which should be evaluated as a loop
**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Running the following:
`./build-image-multi-arch.sh -v 1.0.1 -f ./dockerfiles/opensearch.al2.dockerfile -p opensearch -a "x64,arm64" -r "myrepo/opensearch:1.0.1"`

Returns the following
We only support 'x64' and 'arm64' as architecture name for -a parameter

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Plugins**
Please list all plugins currently enabled.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Host/Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. Linux/Windows]
 - Version [e.g. 1.0.0]

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: Fix file extension of signature files in signer workflow.

labels.name: triaged
labels.description: This issue has been reviewed by the triage team

body:
Right now the signer workflow is invoking the client and specifying the output with -o as a *.asc file.  In reality, the file returned from the client is a binary (.sig) file and not ascii armored.

Until [this](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-signer-client/issues/10) issue is resolved to specify the desired file type we should change the extension and correctly mark these as .sig files.

body: Flake8 config flags both W503 and W504 as noncompliant. W503 has been replaced with W504. Need to fix the config to ignore W503. It probably happens due to older pipenv version?

title: [BUG] Snapshot bundle cannot be assembled
body:
**Describe the bug**

OpenSearch doesn't support installing builds that declare -SNAPSHOT in plugin descriptor. Assembly fails with `java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: illegal version format - snapshot labels are not supported`.

**To Reproduce**

```
./bundle-workflow/build.sh manifests/opensearch-1.1.0.yml --snapshot
./bundle-workflow/assemble.sh manifests/opensearch-1.1.0.yml

-> Installing file:/tmp/tmpe_np2do4/opensearch-security-1.1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.zip
-> Downloading file:/tmp/tmpe_np2do4/opensearch-security-1.1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.zip
-> Failed installing file:/tmp/tmpe_np2do4/opensearch-security-1.1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.zip
-> Rolling back file:/tmp/tmpe_np2do4/opensearch-security-1.1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.zip
-> Rolled back file:/tmp/tmpe_np2do4/opensearch-security-1.1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.zip
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: illegal version format - snapshot labels are not supported
        at org.opensearch.Version.fromStringSlow(Version.java:177)
        at org.opensearch.Version.fromString(Version.java:172)
        at org.opensearch.plugins.PluginInfo.readFromProperties(PluginInfo.java:212)
        at org.opensearch.plugins.InstallPluginCommand.loadPluginInfo(InstallPluginCommand.java:799)
        at org.opensearch.plugins.InstallPluginCommand.installPlugin(InstallPluginCommand.java:858)
        at org.opensearch.plugins.InstallPluginCommand.execute(InstallPluginCommand.java:263)
        at org.opensearch.plugins.InstallPluginCommand.execute(InstallPluginCommand.java:237)
        at org.opensearch.cli.EnvironmentAwareCommand.execute(EnvironmentAwareCommand.java:99)
        at org.opensearch.cli.Command.mainWithoutErrorHandling(Command.java:140)
        at org.opensearch.cli.MultiCommand.execute(MultiCommand.java:104)
        at org.opensearch.cli.Command.mainWithoutErrorHandling(Command.java:140)
        at org.opensearch.cli.Command.main(Command.java:103)
        at org.opensearch.plugins.PluginCli.main(PluginCli.java:60)
```

**Expected behavior**

Not sure. Do we need to assemble a snapshot bundle? Probably not.

**Additional Context**

https://github.com/opensearch-project/OpenSearch/blob/19e54d662488a183c1388e66cfe7463a24c6aa7c/buildSrc/src/main/resources/plugin-descriptor.properties#L48 says that the version of `opensearch.version` is the one built against.

title: [BUG] Docker image fails to download/run if the userns security option is enabled

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: Issues that have not yet been triaged

labels.name: beta
labels.description: Issues specific to the OpenSearch Beta

body:
**Describe the bug**
If the **userns** option of Docker is enabled even pulling the image fails:

`$ docker pull opensearchproject/opensearch`
`failed to register layer: ApplyLayer exit status 1 stdout:  stderr: Container ID 12011476 cannot be mapped to a host ID`

It seems the image contains some **high user ids** that cannot be mapped to a host user id.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Enable userns on the Docker daemon. See https://docs.docker.com/engine/security/userns-remap/
2. Pull the opensearch image

**Expected behavior**
Opensearch should work with userns enabled.

**Host/Environment:**
 - OS: Arch Linux
 - Docker: 20.10.8

**Additional context**
* The problem and a way to solve it are also describe at https://circleci.com/docs/2.0/high-uid-error/
* The elasticsearch:7.10 (I did not test newer versions) works fine with userns

title: [BUG] Likely root cause: java.lang.RuntimeException: Demo certificates found
body:
**Describe the bug**
On starting container, opensearch if raising an error:
```
Aug 18 07:13:52 elasticsearch.sftests.com opensearch[468870]: java.lang.IllegalStateException: failed to load plugin class [org.opensearch.security.OpenSearchSecurityPlugin]
Aug 18 07:13:52 elasticsearch.sftests.com opensearch[468870]: Likely root cause: java.lang.RuntimeException: Demo certificates found [d14aefe70a592d7a29e14f3ff89c3d0070c99e87d21776aa07d333ee877e758f, 54a70016e0837a2b0c5658d1032d7ca32e432c62c55f01a2bf5adcb69a0a7ba9, bdc141ab2272c779d0f242b79063152c49e1b06a2af05e0fd90d505f2b44d5f5, 3e839e2b059036a99ee4f742814995f2fb0ced7e9d68a47851f43a3c630b5324, 9b13661c073d864c28ad7b13eda67dcb6cbc2f04d116adc7c817c20b4c7ed361]
```
then it quit.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Start container with example parameters:
```
  podman create --name opensearch --net host --pid host \
    -v DISABLE_INSTALL_DEMO_CONFIG=true \
    -v cluster.name=elasticsearch_sftests_coma \
    -v node.name=elk \
    -v discovery.seed_hosts=elk \
    -v cluster.initial_master_nodes=elk \
    -v "OPENSEARCH_JAVA_OPTS=-Xms512m -Xmx512m" \
    -v /mnt/opensearch/data:/usr/share/opensearch/data:Z \
    -v /mnt/opensearch/logs:/var/log/opensearch:Z \
    -v /etc/opensearch/certs/localCA.pem:/usr/share/opensearch/config/localCA.pem:Z \
    -v /etc/opensearch/certs/elasticsearch-admin.crt:/usr/share/opensearch/config/elasticsearch-admin.crt:Z \
    -v /etc/opensearch/certs/elasticsearch-admin.key:/usr/share/opensearch/config/elasticsearch-admin.key:Z \
    -v /etc/opensearch/opensearch.yml:/usr/share/opensearch/config/opensearch.yml:Z \
    -v /etc/opensearch/internal_users.yml:/usr/share/opensearch/plugins/opensearch-security/securityconfig/internal_users.yml:Z \
    -v /etc/opensearch/roles_mapping.yml:/usr/share/opensearch/plugins/opensearch-security/securityconfig/roles_mapping.yml:Z \
    -v /etc/opensearch/tenants.yml:/usr/share/opensearch/plugins/opensearch-security/securityconfig/tenants.yml:Z \
    -v /etc/opensearch/roles.yml:/usr/share/opensearch/plugins/opensearch-security/securityconfig/roles.yml:Z \
    -v /etc/opensearch/action_groups.yml:/usr/share/opensearch/plugins/opensearch-security/securityconfig/action_groups.yml:Z
    opensearchproject/opensearch:1.0.0
```
opensearch.yml
```
cluster.name: elasticsearch_sftests_com
node.name: elk
path.data: /usr/share/opensearch/data
path.logs: /var/log/opensearch
network.host: XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX
http.port: 9200

node.master: true

cluster.routing.allocation.disk.threshold_enabled: false
node.max_local_storage_nodes: 3

plugins.security.ssl.transport.enforce_hostname_verification: false
plugins.security.ssl.http.enabled: true
plugins.security.allow_default_init_securityindex: true
# No matter if plugins.security.allow_unsafe_democertificates is set to true or false,
# problem will raise.
plugins.security.allow_unsafe_democertificates: false

plugins.security.ssl.transport.pemcert_filepath: /usr/share/opensearch/config/elasticsearch-admin.crt
plugins.security.ssl.transport.pemkey_filepath: /usr/share/opensearch/config/elasticsearch-admin.key
plugins.security.ssl.transport.pemtrustedcas_filepath: /usr/share/opensearch/config/localCA.pem
plugins.security.ssl.http.pemcert_filepath: /usr/share/opensearch/config/elasticsearch-admin.crt
plugins.security.ssl.http.pemkey_filepath: /usr/share/opensearch/config/elasticsearch-admin.key
plugins.security.ssl.http.pemtrustedcas_filepath: /usr/share/opensearch/config/localCA.pem
plugins.security.authcz.admin_dn:
  - CN=elasticsearch.sftests.com,O=ElasticsearchSoftwareFactory,L=WROCLAW,ST=WROCLAW,C=PL

plugins.security.enable_snapshot_restore_privilege: true
plugins.security.check_snapshot_restore_write_privileges: true
plugins.security.restapi.roles_enabled: ["all_access", "security_rest_api_access"]
plugins.security.system_indices.enabled: true
```

**Expected behavior**
Service will start normally

**Host/Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Linux Centos Stream
 - Version 1.0.0

**Additional context**
Environment variable DISABLE_INSTALL_DEMO_CONFIG seems not to work. The demo certificates are still in the
container image.

title: [BUG] Bundle manifest not defined correctly

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: Issues that have not yet been triaged

labels.name: beta
labels.description: Issues specific to the OpenSearch Beta

body:
**Describe the bug**
The expected syntax for bundle manifest file is #111 . The [test infra expects a bunch of parameters](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/bundle-workflow/python/manifests/bundle_manifest.py#L12) which are missing in the manifest file and because of that it breaks. 

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "python/test.py", line 17, in <module>
    manifest = BundleManifest.from_file(args.manifest)
  File "/home/ubuntu/cicd/opensearch-build/bundle-workflow/python/manifests/bundle_manifest.py", line 29, in from_file
    return BundleManifest(yaml.safe_load(file))
  File "/home/ubuntu/cicd/opensearch-build/bundle-workflow/python/manifests/bundle_manifest.py", line 35, in __init__
    self.build = self.Build(data['build'])
  File "/home/ubuntu/cicd/opensearch-build/bundle-workflow/python/manifests/bundle_manifest.py", line 51, in __init__
    self.architecture = data['architecture']
KeyError: 'architecture'
```

**Reproduce**
Run the test.py from `main` branch of opensearch-build repo

`~/opensearch-build/bundle-workflow$ python python/test.py --manifest /home/ubuntu/cicd/opensearch-build/manifests/opensearch-1.0.0.yml`

title: Correct copyright notices to reflect Copyright OpenSearch Contributors
body:
Coming from https://github.com/opensearch-project/.github/issues/21.

The correct copyright for open-source projects in opensearch-project is "Copyright OpenSearch Contributors". Please correct any places that say otherwise, especially where it says copyright Amazon. Make sure NOTICE.txt and README match. See https://github.com/opensearch-project/.github/pull/24 for an example.

title: Update build system to build knn
body:
Right now our build script for knn only includes the .zip but is not building and including knnlib.  The knnlib is required during bundle assembly.

This is because it is using the standard-gradle-build script in https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/tree/main/scripts/bundle-build/.

- This component should have a custom script here - [here](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/tree/main/bundle-workflow/scripts/bundle-build/components). That builds both the lib and plugin zip.  The lib should be placed in /libs and plugin zip in /plugins.
- This component's snapshot build by passing -Dbuild.snapshot=true needs to work and output -SNAPSHOT artifacts.

Example of this being built is [here](https://github.com/opendistro-for-elasticsearch/k-NN/blob/main/.github/workflows/CD.yml#L82-L239)

title: Update build system to build performance-analyzer
body:
Currently Performance-analyzer is commented out in the [InputManifest](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/manifests/opensearch-bundle.1.0.yml) for 1.0.  

This component should be included with all the others but its build is currently failing if uncommented.

- This component requires performance-analyzer-rca to also be assembled and included within performance-analyzer-rca.zip. [Example](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/release/tar/linux/opensearch-tar-build.sh#L147) of it being required during bundle assembly. 
- This component's snapshot build by passing -Dbuild.snapshot=true needs to work and output -SNAPSHOT artifacts.

title: [BUG] Owner userid of files in opensearchproject/opensearch:1.0.0 causes error with docker + userns
body:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. `docker pull opensearchproject/opensearch:1.0.0`
2. When extracting layer f4eb0e854a62 the pull fails with `failed to register layer: Error processing tar file(exit status 1): Container ID 12011476 cannot be mapped to a host ID`

**Expected behavior**
The pulls succeeds, as it did for opensearchproject/opensearch:1.0.0-rc1

**Host/Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Debian 10
 - Version 1.0.0
 - Docker 20.10.7, Swarm mode

**Additional context**
Looking at the linux-x64 tarballs of 1.0.0 and 1.0.0-rc1 from https://opensearch.org/artifacts/ the problem seems to come from the user ids stored in the tarball: The tarball opensearch-1.0.0-rc1-linux-x64.tar.gz of 1.0.0-rc1 which works has the files in the tarball owned by uid 995/gid 993
```
$ tar --numeric-owner -vtf ~/Downloads/opensearch-1.0.0-rc1-linux-x64.tar.gz | head
drwxr-xr-x 995/993           0 2021-06-03 22:49 opensearch-1.0.0-rc1/
drwxr-xr-x 995/993           0 2021-05-28 20:19 opensearch-1.0.0-rc1/lib/
-rw-r--r-- 995/993    13058405 2021-05-28 20:19 opensearch-1.0.0-rc1/lib/opensearch-1.0.0-rc1.jar
-rw-r--r-- 995/993        6546 2021-05-28 20:19 opensearch-1.0.0-rc1/lib/opensearch-plugin-classloader-1.0.0-rc1.jar
```
while the tarball opensearch-1.0.0-linux-x64.tar.gz of 1.0.0 which does not work has the files in the tarball owned by uid 12011476/gid 100 (note the uid 12011476 which matches the 'Container ID' in the docker error message)
```
$ tar --numeric-owner -vtf ~/Downloads/opensearch-1.0.0-linux-x64.tar.gz | head
drwxr-xr-x 12011476/100      0 2021-07-09 00:32 opensearch-1.0.0/
-rwxr-xr-x 12011476/100   3132 2021-07-09 00:32 opensearch-1.0.0/opensearch-tar-install.sh
drwxr-xr-x 12011476/100      0 2021-07-09 00:32 opensearch-1.0.0/bin/
-rwxr-xr-x 12011476/100   4890 2021-07-03 01:22 opensearch-1.0.0/bin/opensearch-env
```
which is outside of the 0 to 65536 uid range normally allowed in a user namespace (due to the default size of the dockremap subuid allocation).

I think the Dockerfile should probably normalize the uid/gid of the extracted files when unpacking the tarball [here in line 53](https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/release/docker/dockerfiles/opensearch.al2.dockerfile#L53) so the uid/gid stored in the tarball does not leak into the container image. The `chmod -R` on line 81 is too late as at this point there is already a layer with the invalid uid after the copy on line 68.

title: securityadmin.sh can't find JAVA_HOME in docker container

labels.name: untriaged
labels.description: Issues that have not yet been triaged

body:
**Describe the bug**
When setting customized certificates in a dockerized cluster, you need to call securityadmin.sh from ./plugins/opensearch-security/tools in a running container. The script securityadmin.sh is unable to find JAVA_HOME. After setting exporting JAVA_HOME like
`export JAVA_HOME=/usr/share/opensearch/jdk`
securityadmin.sh can be called without problems.
There should be a JAVA_HOME Variable set in the docker container

title: JAVA_HOME missing in dockerhub image
body:
When using the official dockerhub image "opensearchproject/opensearch:1.0.0-rc1" the env var "JAVA_HOME" is not defined, breaking /tools/securityadmin.sh:
https://github.com/opensearch-project/security/blob/2ecb088a1ac58bd1ac4a0c1100492bc1566b9be7/tools/securityadmin.sh#L19

To fix it I manually set the env var `JAVA_HOME=/usr/share/opensearch/jdk`, but maybe this can be fixed in the image or in the plugin?
